learned_patterns.notes: Always configure port to 3100+ to avoid conflicts
Must include index.html for Vite projects

learned_patterns.description: Custom Hook Pattern for Business Logic
learned_patterns.notes: useCalculator hook pattern works well for stateful operations

challenges: Needed to choose between Vite and Next.js
solutions: Chose Vite since app is client-side only (no SSR needed)
Fixed tailwind.config.js content paths to include index.html

challenges: Complex calculation logic mixed with UI
solutions: Created useCalculator hook to encapsulate business logic
Separated pure calculation functions to calculators/ directory

task_history.summary: Built complete calculator with Vite+React+TypeScript, 69 tests passing, 100% coverage on calculation logic

Implemented complete auth lifecycle: login() method, logout() method, useAuth hook, Login page with error handling. Token auto-injection working. 7 auth tests passing (some fail due to backend rate limiting).

common_mistakes.mistake: Forgot to include index.html in Tailwind content paths
common_mistakes.prevention: Always check tailwind.config.js content array includes index.html and all src paths
common_mistakes.checklist_item: Verify Tailwind content paths after initial setup

common_mistakes.mistake: Put calculation logic directly in components
common_mistakes.impact: Hard to test, components too large
common_mistakes.prevention: Always extract business logic to custom hooks or pure functions
common_mistakes.checklist_item: Create calculators/ or utils/ for complex logic

preferred_approaches.approach: Use React useState for simple forms, React Hook Form for complex forms
preferred_approaches.reason: useState is simpler for basic cases, RHF handles validation better
preferred_approaches.example: gpu-calculator uses useState for the training form

preferred_approaches.approach: Extract to custom hooks with loading/error states
preferred_approaches.reason: Keeps components clean, makes testing easier

preferred_approaches.approach: Group by purpose: layout/, forms/, results/, common/
preferred_approaches.reason: Easy to find components, scales well

preferred_approaches.approach: Tailwind utility classes + custom color palette in theme
preferred_approaches.reason: Consistent design, fast development, small bundle

efficiency_improvements.old_approach: Manual configuration of TypeScript, Tailwind, testing
efficiency_improvements.new_approach: npm create vite@latest with template, then add Tailwind and Vitest configs from patterns
Vitest with jsdom - same API, faster, simpler config
